intro: Euphorbia cuchumatanensis, commonly known as the Cuchumatán euphorbia, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It is characterized by its succulent, spiny stems and produces small, yellowish-green cyathia, which are its unique floral structures. The plant thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in dry or rocky habitats. It has adapted to arid environments with thick, fleshy leaves that store water. Euphorbia cuchumatanensis is also noted for its toxic sap, which can cause skin irritation.
